chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mike Anand Chand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw Or Discharge Bodily Fluids At Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence, credit for 133 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court sets restitution to zero.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol.
No possession of illegal drugs unless prescribed by a doctor.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Comply with random urine analysis tests.

charges.descr: Throw Or Discharge Bodily Fluids At Public Safety Worker

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mike Anand Chand

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  (Mike A. Chand - #631933, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Filed: Original Transcript of Plea and Sentencing ( 28 pages) commencing 07-14-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Defendant Mike Anand Chand in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Mike Anand Chand in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mike Anand Chand appeared by video means. Court holds colloquy with defendant. Court finds that defendant is voluntarily and intelligently waiving right to personal appearance. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 133 DAYS time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Comply with random urine analysis tests.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No use or posession of alcohol.
- No possession of illegal drugs unless prescribed by a doctor.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Complete 50 hours of community service. 

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program 
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Jury instructions
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (7 pages) commencing 04-14-2022, by KATHLEEN S. WORDEN.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Mike Anand Chand not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned to branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mike Anand Chand in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Mike Anand Chand in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: O. Pedroza-Beltran. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mike Anand Chand not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Mike Anand Chand in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Mike Anand Chand in custody.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mike Anand Chand appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
